Package bio.singa.mathematics.matrices

Interface Matrix

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Addable<Matrix>, AdditivelyInvertible<Matrix>, Invertible<Matrix>, MultiDimensional<Matrix>, Multipliable<Matrix>, Ring<Matrix>, Subtractable<Matrix>, Transformable<Matrix>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LabeledMatrix<LabelType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LabeledRegularMatrix, LabeledSymmetricMatrix, RegularMatrix, SquareMatrix, SymmetricMatrix
    public interface Matrix
extends MultiDimensional<Matrix>, Ring<Matrix>, Transformable<Matrix>
    The Matrix interface represents a two-dimensional collection of values (like a table with rows and columns) where multiple operations are defined.

    Each implementation is: addable, subtractable, additively invertible and multipliable.

    • Method Detail

      • as

        <M extends Matrix> M as​(java.lang.Class<M> matrixClass)
        Converts this matrix into a specific implementation. This only works if the "form" of this class is suitable to be converted. The new matrix is a copy of the old one.
        Type Parameters:
        M - Any implementation of this matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrixClass - The new class of the matrix.
        Returns:
        The new converted matrix.

      • transpose

        Matrix transpose()
        The transposition of this m-by-n matrix is a new matrix n-by-m formed by turning columns into rows and vice versa.
        Returns:
        The transposition of this matrix.

      • multiply

        Matrix multiply​(double scalar)
        The scalar multiplication is an algebraic operation that returns a new matrix where each element is multiplied by the given scalar.
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar.
        Returns:
        The scalar multiplication.

      • multiply

        Vector multiply​(Vector multiplicand)
        The multiplication of this matrix with the given vector is an algebraic operation that returns a new vector that is transformed with this matrix. The new vector will have the same dimensionality as the row dimension of the matrix. The column dimension of this matrix and the dimension of the vector must agree.
        Parameters:
        multiplicand - The vector to be transformed.
        Returns:
        The transformed vector.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDimensionsException - if the column dimension of the matrix and the dimension of the vector do not agree.

      • hadamardMultiply

        Matrix hadamardMultiply​(Matrix multiplicand)
        The Hadamard multiplication is the element-wise multiplication of two matrices. This operation takes two matrices of the same dimensions, and produces another matrix where each element ij is the product of elements ij of the original two matrices.
        Parameters:
        multiplicand - The multiplicand.
        Returns:
        The Hadamard product.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDimensionsException - if the column dimension and the row dimension of this matrix and the given matrix do not agree.

      • getElements

        double[][] getElements()
        Returns all elements of this matrix.
        Returns:
        All elements of this matrix as an two-dimensional array.

      • streamElements

        default java.util.stream.DoubleStream streamElements()
        Returns a stream of all elements in the matrix, where columns are traversed first and rows second. So e.g. a matrix with 3 rows and 4 columns is traversed column: c1,r1 - c1,r2 - c1,r3 - c2,r1 - ... c4,r3
        Returns:
        a stream of all elements in the matrix.

      • forEach

        default void forEach​(java.util.function.BiConsumer<Pair<java.lang.Integer>,​java.lang.Double> action)
        Returns a stream of all positions in the form of pairs and the respective elements. In the pairs, the first element represents the row index and the second element the column index.
        Parameters:
        action - The action.

      • getCopy

        default <M extends Matrix> M getCopy()
        Returns an explicit copy of this matrix. A new array is created and filled with values.
        Type Parameters:
        M - The concrete implementation of this vector.
        Returns:
        An exact copy of and as a unrelated copy (safe to modify).
